metadata.title: CVE-2022-23218 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The deprecated compatibility function svcunix_create in the sunrpc moduleof the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34 copies its path argument onthe stack without validating its length, which may result in a bufferoverflow, potentially resulting in a denial of service or (if anapplication is not built with a stack protector enabled) arbitrary codeexecution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23218` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1').
